Note: Cf. 1607 and 2921; for the South English Legendary version, see 4742.
Subjects: Patrick, saint; saints’ lives; visions, of the afterlife
_description: Owayne Miles, a version of St. Patrick’s Purgatory — in 6-line tail-rhyme stanzas

NLS1921.First Lines:
…& liued in dedeli sinneSeyn Patrike hadde
                    rewþe…
NLS1921.Last Lines: …Graunt ous heuen blis aboueBi for his swete face
NLS1921.Note:
1186 lines including imperfect beginning and lacuna at f.
                        31ra.
